result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tvon Malik-Lee Ferguson

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Violation Report - 09-16-2022
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for LEVEL 5 SUPERVISION.

Defendant Tvon Malik-Lee Ferguson in court, in custody.  Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons in court for Tvon Malik-Lee Ferguson.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2 AND 3:
Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to pleas, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Court vacated jury trial. 
 Court scheduled a sentencing date.  Defense requests to be heard on bail.  State requests remand.  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  This matter will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Received and Filed: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum
Received and Filed:  Defendant's Bail Motion

Defendant Tvon Malik-Lee Ferguson in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Tvon Malik-Lee Ferguson in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tvon Malik-Lee Ferguson appeared by video means.
Final pretrial held. Defendant requests to withdraw speedy trial demand. Court grants request. Defense informs court of proceedings regarding defendant's pending case. For reasons stated on the record, court orders 9/6 jury trial remain set, but ordered case be set for plea hearing date.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter Advising the Court Defendant has been Released from Custody

Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons in court, defendant Tvon Malik-Lee Ferguson not in court, in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status hearing.  Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Court set final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant previously entered a Demand for Speedy Trial on JUNE 10, 2022.
EXPIRATION DATE IS SEPTEMBER 8, 2022.

Defendant Tvon Malik-Lee Ferguson in Court with Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Tvon Malik-Lee Ferguson in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski and Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant has Case 22CF760 pending in Branch 46; however, Case 22CF2142 should have NOT been transferred to Branch 46. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received discovery and an offer from the State. Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Case transfered back to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Case adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 40. Status hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:45 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant Tvon Malik-Lee Ferguson in court, appear by video with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons, appear by video.  Defendant Tvon Malik-Lee Ferguson in custody. Constantine Siapkaris appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer R.Washington   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Tvon Malik-Lee Ferguson in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Tvon Malik-Lee Ferguson in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tvon Malik-Lee Ferguson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised that due to a lower pending matter, this case has been re-assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 3.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
